paper_abstract: The kinematics of some mobile robots is described through a strictly invariant Jacobian matrix [J]. This is the case for robots with three degrees of freedom and suitable omnidirectional wheels, and that for robots with conventional wheels and differential kinematics. This article proposes a calibration technique for the matrix [J] of such robots. It is based on four accurate configuration measurements associated with particular nominal motions where the generalized velocities maintain a constant proportional relationship. As a consequence, the nominal trajectories are arcs of circumference and may be part of the actual trajectories of the robot. An application example is presented. (C) 2009 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Calibration for mobile robots with an invariant Jacobian
